perturbation.original_text: Prior to returning any Product, whether for exchange or warranty or non-warranty action, Distributor must obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR. Distributor should return the product to NETGEAR, [*]. NETGEAR will not accept collect shipments. Any Product returned to NETGEAR, which is not returned in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, may be rejected.
perturbation.changed_text: Prior to returning any Product, Distributor may need to obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR. Distributor should return the product to NETGEAR. NETGEAR may not accept collect shipments. Any Product returned to NETGEAR, which is not returned in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, may be rejected.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the mandatory RMA requirement, making it discretionary. By introducing a 'may need' clause and deleting '[*}', the Distributor now bears an undue burden of cost associated with returning a potentially defective product. This contradicts implied warranty of merchantability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty of Merchantability under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and the California Consumer Rights Act

perturbation.original_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials for its respective warranty period which begins on the date of purchase by the end user. Should a Product fail within this warranty period, Distributor shall replace such defective Product from Distributor's inventory and accept return of the failed Product from Distributor's customer. At intervals to be mutually agreed upon between NETGEAR and Distributor. Distributor shall contact NETGEAR to receive a Return Material Authorization number for the collected failed Product. Upon receipt of the failed Product, NETGEAR shall issue a credit to Distributor for Distributor's purchase price of the replacement Product issued, less any prior credits or allowances. End-users' exclusive remedy is to receive replacement Product from reseller and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to issue an off-setting credit to reseller for Product returned by reseller on behalf of its end-user because of defects in workmanship or material.
perturbation.changed_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials. Should a Product fail, Distributor may replace such defective Product from Distributor's inventory and accept return of the failed Product from Distributor's customer. Distributor shall contact NETGEAR for the failed Product. End-users' exclusive remedy is to receive replacement Product from reseller and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to issue an off-setting credit to reseller for Product returned by reseller on behalf of its end-user because of defects in workmanship or material.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the warranty period and removes the RMA requirement. Removing the 'respective warranty period which begins on the date of purchase by the end user' removes a critical component of the warranty, making it difficult for end-users to claim warranty coverage. The addition of the word 'may' weakens the obligation to replace. These changes violate consumer protection laws requiring clear warranty terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act (if applicable based on product price) and implied warranties under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC)

perturbation.original_text: NETGEAR and Distributor agree to comply with the provisions of all applicable federal, state, county and local laws, ordinances, regulations and codes, domestic and foreign.
perturbation.changed_text: NETGEAR and Distributor may attempt to comply with the provisions of some applicable federal, state, county and local laws, ordinances, regulations and codes, domestic and foreign.
perturbation.explanation: By weakening the compliance obligation to a mere attempt ('may attempt'), the contract undermines the legal requirement for adherence to applicable laws. This introduces a legal risk because it suggests that non-compliance is a possibility, which is unlawful.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General legal principles requiring compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.
